about_the_game:
The Heart of the World, "Cronium," has been shattered, scattering fragments across the land.
Only children under the age of 10 can survive the six months leading to the world’s destruction.
This is the story of 7 children and 1 cat, watched over by a single small bird.

■ Strategic battles using "clocks" to manipulate time.
Children (and the cat) cannot wield weapons.
Instead, they equip skills at the 0, 3, 6, and 9 o’clock marks of their clocks, allowing for highly strategic combat.
Combine the strengths of both children and adults to create powerful synergies.

■ Fly as a small bird across the map.
In Bird Mode, you can freely fly around the map, searching for items and solving puzzles in a point-and-click style.
While you can control all the main characters, the bird represents you in this world, adding a unique flavor to the experience.

■ Rewind time and discover the paths of fate.
Scenes from April to October are saved as a storyline.
Once you meet certain conditions, you can revisit and replay any scene.
A seemingly small event—like something a tiny bird might trigger—could completely alter the course of fate.
Can you find a way to change this world?

■ Mischief, mischief!!
Children love pranks—even if the world is ending!
Doodle on backs, startle adults with firecrackers...
A serious and emotional story can quickly be derailed by your antics.
Sometimes, new side stories will emerge from your playful mischief.

■ Other Features:

  • All maps and characters are hand-drawn, bringing a warm and vibrant touch to the world. The soundtrack is fully original.

  • The world’s collapse doesn’t happen instantly; it deteriorates slowly.
    On the field, erosion spreads: the ground darkens, and icons shift from white to orange, then to ominous red.

  • There is no leveling system. This story doesn’t suit characters becoming muscle-bound heroes.
    Instead, you collect, upgrade, and enhance equipment and skills to face stronger enemies.
